text: The 1964 Valley State Matadors football team represented Valley StateCalifornia State University, Northridge was known as San Fernando Valley State College from 1958 to 1971. during the 1964 NCAA College Division football season. Valley State competed in the California Collegiate Athletic Association (CCAA). The Matadors were led by third-year head coach Sam Winningham. They played home games at Monroe High in Sepulveda, California.The community of North Hills, California (within the City of Los Angeles) was known as Sepulveda, California from World War II to 1992. They finished the season with a record of four wins and six losses (4–6, 1–3 CCAA). ==Schedule== ==Team players in the NFL== No Valley State players were selected in the 1965 NFL Draft. ==Notes== ==References== Valley State Category:Cal State Northridge Matadors football seasons Valley State Matadors football
title: 1964 Valley State Matadors football team
